recipes.name: Cheesy Egg and Veggie Wraps
instructions: Step 1: Scramble the eggs with a little butter until fully cooked.
Step 2: Chop the bell peppers and sauté them with some butter until slightly soft.
Step 3: Spread cream cheese on the tortillas.
Step 4: Add cooked scrambled eggs, sautéed peppers, and string cheese to the tortilla.
Step 5: Roll the tortillas and warm them on a skillet until the cheese melts.
Step 6: Add fresh arugula before serving.

recipes.name: Fruit and Nut Arugula Salad
instructions: Step 1: Chop apples and pears into thin slices.
Step 2: Rinse and dry arugula, place in a large salad bowl.
Step 3: Add sliced apples, pears, and almonds to the arugula.
Step 4: Tear mint leaves into small pieces and add to salad.
Step 5: Toss everything with Annie's dressing.
Step 6: Serve immediately for a fresh salad.

recipes.name: Apple Cheddar Panini
instructions: Step 1: Thinly slice the apple using a knife or mandoline.
Step 2: Spread butter on one side of each tortilla.
Step 3: On the non-buttered side, layer slices of apple and string cheese.
Step 4: Optionally, add fresh basil leaves for extra flavor.
Step 5: Fold the tortilla and grill on a panini press until golden and cheesy.
Step 6: Cut in half and serve warm.

recipes.name: Spicy Cream Cheese Stuffed Bell Peppers
instructions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Cut the tops of the bell peppers and scoop out the seeds.
Step 3: Mix cream cheese with a drizzle of spicy brown mustard in a bowl.
Step 4: Stuff each bell pepper with the cream cheese mixture.
Step 5: Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes until peppers are tender.
Step 6: Serve warm as an appetizer or side dish.

recipes.name: Pasta Primavera with Tomato and Pickled Onions
instructions: Step 1: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Step 2: Add chopped tomatoes and sun-dried tomatoes to the skillet and cook until soft.
Step 3: Toss in shredded red cabbage and cook until just wilted.
Step 4: Add cooked pasta to the skillet along with a splash of dijon mustard.
Step 5: Stir in pickled onions and arugula, cooking just until arugula is wilted.
Step 6: Serve hot, garnished with extra pickled onions if desired.
